title: 111_hr3743
content:
The Small Business Disaster Readiness and Reform Act of 2009 amends the Small Business Act to revise collateral requirements for loans under $250,000, removing the need for borrowers to use their home as collateral. SEC. 3. INCREASED LIMITS. The Small Business Act is amended to increase the limits for loans. SEC. 4. REVISED REPAYMENT TERMS. The Act is further amended to revise repayment terms for loans. SEC. 5. REVISED DISBURSEMENT PROCESS. Additional changes are made to the disbursement process for loans. Section 7(f) of the Small Business Act is amended to include a revised disbursement process for loans. For loans under $150,000, the first disbursement will be 40% of the total amount, with the second disbursement being 50% of the remaining loan amount. The revised disbursement process for loans under the Small Business Act includes three disbursements. The second disbursement is 50% of the remaining loan amount after the first disbursement, and the third disbursement is made when satisfactory receipts are provided for the proper use of the previous disbursements. For loans between $150,000 and $500,000, the disbursement process includes three stages: 20% of the total loan amount is disbursed initially, followed by 30% of the remaining amount after the first disbursement. The final disbursement is made when satisfactory receipts are provided for the proper use of the previous disbursements. The third disbursement is 25% of remaining loan amounts after the first and second disbursements, given upon satisfactory receipts for proper use of the first disbursement and 50% of the second disbursement. The fourth disbursement is the remaining loan amounts after previous disbursements, given upon satisfactory receipts for proper use of the first and second disbursements and 50% of the third disbursement. The third disbursement for loans over $500,000 must be at least $100,000, with subsequent disbursements at the Administrator's discretion but also at least $100,000 each. The grant program outlined in Section 6 provides funding for eligible recipients. Section 7(b) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow the Administrator to provide grants up to $100,000 to small businesses affected by disasters, with conditions for eligibility. The Small Business Act is amended to allow the Administrator to provide grants up to $100,000 to small businesses affected by disasters. Priority is given to economically viable businesses unable to meet short-term financial obligations. The Small Business Act allows the Administrator to provide grants of up to $100,000 for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. Appropriations are authorized as needed for this purpose. SEC. 7. REGIONAL DISASTER WORKING GROUPS. Section 40 of the Small Business Act is amended to include the establishment of Regional Disaster Working Groups for disaster preparedness and response planning in cooperation with federal, state, and local authorities and businesses. The Small Business Act is amended to establish Regional Disaster Working Groups for disaster preparedness and response planning in cooperation with authorities and businesses. Plans must include strategies for the three most likely disasters in the region. SEC. 8. OUTREACH GRANTS FOR LOAN APPLICANT ASSISTANCE. Section 7(b) of the Small Business Act is amended to authorize grants for loan applicant assistance in disaster-affected areas to women's business centers, small business development centers, Veteran Business Outreach Centers, and chambers of commerce. The Small Business Act is amended to authorize grants for loan applicant assistance in disaster-affected areas to various entities. These entities can use the grants to provide application preparation assistance to loan applicants. The Administrator is authorized to make $50,000,000 in grants for each of fiscal years 2010 and 2011. SEC. 9. HOMEOWNERS IMPACTED BY TOXIC DRYWALL.

The Administrator may make a loan to homeowners affected by toxic drywall from China for repair or replacement.

SEC. 10. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.

Authorization of appropriations for administrative expenses and loans under section 7(b) for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. SEC. 11. REGULATIONS.

The Administrator shall issue regulations to carry out this Act and its amendments within 180 days of enactment.
